intro: Haniffia flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered daisy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Haniffia flavescens is often used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
